intro: Timonius albus, commonly known as the white timonius, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate white flowers and slender, branching stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
